Package gameObject.object

Class SnakeAction

java.lang.Object
gameObject.object.SnakeAction

class SnakeAction
extends java.lang.Object
implements ActionType
Snake action controller.

  • Field Details

    • snake

      private Snake snake
      Controlled Snake.

    • waiting

      private boolean waiting
      State of Snake.

      If the snake is disappeared in the scene and looking for a new Log to appear, it is true, otherwise, false.

    • speedChanged

      private boolean speedChanged
      State of Snake movement.

      Snake moves on the log from end to end. It has its own speed in the game scene and normally it is faster than Log. When Snake gets to one end of Log, it turns back with the same value of the previous speed. When it changes, this would be targeted as true. It changes in frames. When it continues on Log, this would be false.

      This is used to implement the action of Snake to turn back on Log.

  • Constructor Details

    • SnakeAction

      public SnakeAction​(Snake snake)

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act​(long now)
      Snake only moves on Log with its own speed.

      Normally its speed is greater than Log so that Snake can actually move on Log rather than following Log. When Snake gets to one end of Log, it turns back with the same value of previous speed. It uses World saved in Snake to get all Log objects currently in World and checks if they are instersecting with Snake. If Snake is intersecting with Log(s), store the reference to the Log, and Snake keeps its movement. If no Log is intersecting with Snake, then Snake turns back. This basically implements the movement of Snake on Log.

      When Snake disappears in game scene, it truns to be waiting, and waits for new Log because Snake can't swim. When Snake finds a proper Log, the coordinate of Snake will be set with the same coordinate as new Log.

      Specified by:
      act in interface ActionType
      Parameters:
      now - the current time
